classData.comment:
/**
     * Remote method to use inside main threads for creating neo based class instances.
     * Be aware that you can only pass configs which can get converted into pure JSON.
     *
     * Rendering a component into the document.body
     * @example:
     *     Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
     *         ntype     : 'button',
     *         autoMount : true,
     *         autoRender: true
     *         text      : 'Hi Nige!'
     *     }).then(id => console.log(id))
     *
     * Inserting a component into a container
     * @example:
     *     Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
     *         ntype      : 'button',
     *         parentId   : 'neo-container-3',
     *         parentIndex: 0
     *         text       : 'Hi Nige!'
     *     }).then(id => console.log(id))
     *
     * @param {Object} config
     * @param {String} [config.importPath] you can lazy load missing classes via this config. dev mode only.
     * @param {String} [config.parentId] passing a parentId will put your instance into a container
     * @param {Number} [config.parentIndex] if a parentId is passed, but no index, neo will use add()
     * @returns {String} the instance id
     */
classData.description:
Remote method to use inside main threads for creating neo based class instances. Be aware that you can only pass configs which can get converted into pure JSON.

Rendering a component into the document.body

tags.title: example:
tags.text:
Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
        ntype     : 'button',
        autoMount : true,
        autoRender: true
        text      : 'Hi Nige!'
    }).then(id => console.log(id))

Inserting a component into a container
tags.value:
Neo.worker.App.createNeoInstance({
        ntype     : 'button',
        autoMount : true,
        autoRender: true
        text      : 'Hi Nige!'
    }).then(id => console.log(id))

Inserting a component into a container

tags.title: example:

params.description: you can lazy load missing classes via this config. dev mode only.
params.name: config.importPath

params.description: passing a parentId will put your instance into a container
params.name: config.parentId

params.description: if a parentId is passed, but no index, neo will use add()
params.name: config.parentIndex

classData.comment:
/**
     * Remote method to use inside main threads for destroying neo based class instances.
     *
     * @example:
     *     Neo.worker.App.destroyNeoInstance('neo-button-3').then(success => console.log(success))
     *
     * @param {String} id
     * @returns {Boolean} returns true, in case the instance was found
     */
classData.description: Remote method to use inside main threads for destroying neo based class instances.

returns.description: returns true, in case the instance was found

classData.name: destroyNeoInstance

     * @param {Object} data

classData.comment:
/**
     * Get configs of any app realm based Neo instance from main
     * @param {Object} data
     * @param {String} data.id
     * @param {String|String[]} data.keys
     * Returns an array of configs if a keys array was passed.
     * Returns the value of a given config directly, in case no array was passed
     * Returns false, in case no instance got found.
     * @returns {*}
     */
classData.description: Get configs of any app realm based Neo instance from main
